t: For the choir director. Of David.
The*pn fool says in his heart, “There’s no God.” They*ln are corrupt; they do vile deeds. There*ln is no one who does good.
The*ln Lord*s looks down from heaven on the human race to*ln see if there is one who is wise, one*ln who seeks God.
All*ln have turned away; all*ln alike have become corrupt. There*ln is no one who does good, not*ln even one.
Will*pn evildoers never understand? They*ln consume my people as they consume bread; they*ln do not call on the Lord.*s
Then*pn they will be filled with dread, for*ln God is with those who are righteous.
You*ln sinners frustrate the plans of the oppressed, but*ln the Lord*s is his refuge.
Oh,*pn that Israel’s deliverance would come from Zion! When*ln the Lord*s restores the fortunes of his people, let*ln Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
